GRISEOFULVIN

Indications and doses

Tinea pedis,

To the skin

  • For adults
    Apply 400 micrograms once daily, apply to an area approximately 13 cm2. increased if necessary to 1.2 mg once daily for maximum treatment duration of 4 weeks, allow each spray to dry between application.

Dermatophyte infections where topical therapy has failed or is inappropriate,

By mouth

  • For adults
    500 mg daily, alternatively 1 g daily, higher dose for severe infections; reduce dose when response occurs, daily dose may be taken once daily or in divided doses.
  • For children 1 month–11 years
    Usual dose 10 mg/kg daily (max. per dose 500 mg), alternatively 20 mg/kg daily, higher dose for severe infections; reduce dose when response occurs, daily dose may be taken once daily or in divided doses.
  • For children 12–17 years
    500 mg daily, alternatively 1 g daily, higher dose for severe infections; reduce dose when response occurs, daily dose may be taken once daily or in divided doses.

Tinea capitis caused by Trichophyton tonsurans ,

By mouth

  • For adults
    1 g once daily, alternatively 1 g daily in divided doses.
  • For children 1 month–11 years
    15–20 mg/kg once daily (max. per dose 1 g), alternatively 15–20 mg/kg daily in divided doses.
  • For children 12–17 years
    1 g once daily, alternatively 1 g daily in divided doses.

Advice when patient is pregnant

With topical use in adults

Manufacturer advises avoid unless potential benefit outweighs risk.

With oral use

Avoid (fetotoxicity and teratogenicity in animals).

Advice regarding hepatic impairment

With oral use

Avoid in severe liver disease.

Contra indications

Known side effects

Specific side effects

rare: erythema multiforme, toxic epidermal necrolysis,

veryRare: headache,

notKnown: abdominal pain, agitation, confusion, depression, diarrhoea, dizziness, dyspepsia, fatigue, glossitis, hepatotoxicity, impaired coordination, impaired hearing, leucopenia, menstrual disturbances, nausea, peripheral neuropathy, photosensitivity, rash, renal failure, sleep disturbances, systemic lupus erythematosus, taste disturbances, vomiting, burning sensation in adults, erythema in adults, hypersensitivity reactions in adults, itching in adults, occasional local irritation in adults,

With topical use in adults

Treatment should be discontinued if side-effects are severe.

Advice for patients and carers

In children

Medicines for Children leaflet: Griseofulvin for fungal infections

www.medicinesforchildren.org.uk/griseofulvin-for-fungal-infections

Cautions regarding administration

  • With topical use: avoid contact with eyes and mucous membranes in adults

Advice regarding conception and contraception

With oral use

Effective contraception required during and for at least 1 month after administration to women (important: effectiveness of oral contraceptives may be reduced, additional contraceptive precautions e.g. barrier method, required).

Men should avoid fathering a child during and for at least 6 months after administration

Unlicensed use

In children

Licensed for use in children (age range not specified by manufacturer).

With oral use in adults

Griseofulvin doses in BNF may differ from those in product literature.

Prepared medicinal forms of GRISEOFULVIN

There can be variation in the licensing of different medicines containing the same drug.

Forms available from special-order manufacturers include: oral suspension,
Tablet
Spray
